page.title: 15FARMING (PART 2)
page.content: {POULTRY ONE INTENSIVE FARM- THOUSANDS OF BATTERY HENS. TWO MORE FARMS KEEP BIRDS, MOSTLY HENS,180 & 300 BIRDS. SOME FARMS KEEP A FEW HENS, DUCKS, TURKEYS, GEESE- FOR EGGS AND EATING. FED ON CORN & MASH. TWO FARMS REAR CHICKS FROM EGGS, ONE BUYS BIRDS AT POINT OF LAY. {PIGS} ONLY ONE FARM KEPT A LOT OF PIGS-105 ANIMALS. SEVERAL KEPT 1 OR 2 FOR PETS. EAT PIG MEAL. TWO SETS OF BABIES PER YEAR- LITTERS OF ABOUT 12. REAR THEM SO FAR THEN SEND ON. {ARABLE ALL FARMS GREW GRASS BUT OTHER CROPS WERE APPLES, POTATOES, SWEDES, CORN, PEAS, OATS & BEET, MOSTLY SOLD PRIVATELY- LITTLE WHOLESALE.
